The rash started at my hairline on the fourth day, was all over my body by day six, and now my arms and legs have purple, bleeding spots. I'm extremely confused and can't even recognize my own family, which is why I need to be hospitalized for these complications.

label: Measles
text: It's been six days now with this bad infection, and my fever won't break from 104.8°F, no matter what medicine I take. My cough has gotten so violent and painful that my breastbone is sore to the touch. I have a constant runny nose. My eyes are red and watery and swollen completely shut, and I am sensitive to light. I remember seeing some little white spots inside my cheeks back on the second day. The rash started at my hairline on day three, and by the next day, it was all over my face and neck. By day five, it had spread to my chest and stomach, and now my whole body is covered in these purple spots that have all merged together. I'm so confused; I don't know who my family is and can't remember anything about myself.

label: Measles
text: It's been six days now, and this infection is hitting me hard with a fever of 104.9°F that won't break, even with medicine. I have a severe, dry-sounding cough that feels like it's coming from deep in my chest, causing discomfort under my breastbone. I have a profuse runny nose, so much that I have to wipe it constantly. My eyes are so severely red and watery and sensitive to light that I need to be in complete darkness; they're almost sealed shut. Three days ago, I noticed the tell-tale Koplik spots with red rings inside my cheeks. The rash started behind my ears on the fourth day, and by day five, it had completely covered my face and neck. Now, it's all over my torso and spreading to my arms and legs, with the purple-red spots merging together. I'm so confused that I can't even recognize my own family.

label: Measles
text: It's been three days now that I've been feeling mildly sick, and my temperature has been running at 101.5°F. I have a dry, tickly cough that comes and goes, along with a mild runny nose. My eyes are a little red and watery and sensitive to light. I haven't seen any Koplik spots in my mouth. This morning, I noticed a few flat, red spots—about 3 or 4 of them, each no bigger than 2mm—popped up just behind my left ear. The rash hasn't moved or gotten any bigger since I first saw it. I'm still able to get my work done from home by just turning down the brightness on my screen. Taking a shower this morning left me feeling a bit tired, but otherwise, I'm managing my daily activities.

label: Measles
text: It's been three days now with a fever of 102.1°F. I can't seem to shake this nagging, dry cough, I have a runny nose, and my eyes have become red and watery and sensitive to light. This morning, I spotted a faint sprinkle of red dots behind my ears, and throughout the afternoon, they've started to advance onto my cheeks. A check of my mouth revealed no Koplik spots. I'm feeling moderately sick overall.

label: Measles
text: It's been three days of symptoms, and my temperature is at 102.1°F. I've been having a dry cough that comes and goes, and it gets worse when I talk. I have a runny nose, so I have to keep blowing it. My eyes are a little red and watery and feel sensitive to light when I look at my computer screen. I checked my mouth and didn't see any white spots. This morning, a rash with small, raised red bumps started, but it's only behind my left ear. There are about 3-4 separate red spots, each around 2mm in size. I also have a mild headache and feel tired all over, but I'm managing to drink fluids and eat small meals.

label: Measles
text: It's been three days, and my fever is at 103.9°F. I have this persistent, harsh, barking cough and a constant, profuse runny nose. My eyes are severely red and watery. I am sensitive to light. Yesterday, on day two, a maculopapular rash started at my temporal hairline, and now it has enveloped my face and neck, and has extended down to my mid-chest. I feel completely exhausted and weak.

label: Measles

label: Measles

The rash started at my hairline last evening, spread across my face and neck while I slept, and is now moving onto my chest as flat red spots.

I have a runny nose, and my eyes are slightly red and watery, and I am sensitive to bright lights. I haven't found any lesions in my mouth. This afternoon, a rash that looks like small, raised red spots came up, but it's only behind my left ear. There are about 2-3 separate red spots, each around 1-2mm. It hasn't spread from that one spot. I've been able to work from home by lowering my screen's brightness. Getting dressed made me feel a bit tired, but I'm still able to do my household chores as long as I take plenty of breaks.

label: Measles

label: Measles
text: This miserable cold has been going on for five days, bringing with it a hacking cough and a runny nose. My eyes are red and watery, and I am sensitive to light. I've consistently had a temperature of 103.5°F. A rash, which the doctor identified as maculopapular, appeared at my hairline yesterday; it has now enveloped my entire face and is starting to creep down onto my chest. On top of everything, I feel terrible and have aches all over my body.

label: Measles
text: This severe infection has been going on for seven days now, with a fever of 105.0°F that won't go down with medicine. I have a severe cough that feels like I'm constantly clearing my throat, along with a runny nose and my eyes are red and watery. I am severely sensitive to light. Five days ago, the characteristic Koplik spots appeared on the inside of my mouth. The rash began behind my ears on day six and has now traveled from my face to cover my neck and upper back, with some of the purple-tinged spots starting to merge. My whole body feels weak and achy, and I'm very disoriented.

label: Measles
text: This severe infection has been going on for six days, with my fever holding at 105.1°F despite antipyretics. My eyes are red and watery and completely swollen shut because I am extremely sensitive to light. On day two, I noticed Koplik spots on the inside of my cheeks. A rash began at my hairline on day three, spread to my face and neck by day four, and reached my chest and abdomen by day five. Now, all of my limbs are covered in confluent, purple-tinged lesions that are starting to show early tissue death. I'm disoriented and don't respond when my family members talk to me.

text: It started three days ago with a dry cough, a really bad runny nose, and red, watery eyes that hurt in the light. My fever was about 101Â°F. This morning, I noticed a red, blotchy rash starting on my face and behind my ears. I am not coughing up any phlegm.

label: Pneumonia
text: For a few days, I've had what felt like a bad cold: fever, runny nose, and my eyes have been very red and sensitive. My cough is dry and doesn't produce any mucus. Today, a rash appeared on my forehead and is now spreading down my neck. There's no stabbing pain in my chest.

label: Pneumonia
text: I had a fever, a hacking dry cough, and really pink, irritated eyes for about four days. I felt miserable. Now, a spotty red rash has started all over my face and is moving down my chest. My breathing has been fine the whole time, with no shortness of breath.

label: Pneumonia
text: The first symptoms were a runny nose, red eyes, and a dry cough that lasted a couple of days along with a fever. Then this rash broke out on my hairline and cheeks yesterday and is on my torso today. The cough is still there, but it's just dry, no thick phlegm.

label: Pneumonia
text: A few days of feeling sick with a dry cough, runny nose, and sore, light-sensitive eyes preceded this. This morning I woke up to a rash on my face. The doctor is not worried about my chest; my breathing is okay and I'm not producing any colored sputum.

label: Pneumonia
text: I have had a persistent fever for over a week now. It seems to get a little higher each day. I have a dull headache at the front of my head that never goes away, and I have absolutely no appetite. I feel incredibly weak. I have no cough or chest pain whatsoever.

label: Pneumonia
text: For about eight days, I've been running a fever that slowly climbs, reaching 103Â°F yesterday. I have a constant headache, some stomach pain, and feel completely drained of energy. I haven't wanted to eat anything for days. My breathing is fine and I have no cough to speak of.

label: Pneumonia
text: This illness has been going on for more than a week. It's a sustained fever, a bad headache, and I feel so tired I can barely function. My stomach has been hurting, and I'm not hungry at all. There are no respiratory issues; my cough is absent and there is no phlegm.

label: Pneumonia
text: My temperature has been high for ten straight days. It started low and just kept creeping up. I have a splitting headache and feel profoundly weak. Sometimes I get stomach cramps. I am not short of breath and have not had a productive cough with any colored sputum.

label: Pneumonia
text: The main problem is a fever that has not gone away for about a week and a half. I also have a constant, dull headache and feel totally exhausted. My stomach feels off and I have not eaten a proper meal in days. I have no chest discomfort and my breathing is normal.

label: Pneumonia
text: For the past 24 hours, I've had to run to the bathroom at least 8 or 9 times. The stools are completely watery. I'm having some bad stomach cramps that come in waves. I feel a bit weak, but I have no fever. There is absolutely no cough or any trouble with my breathing.

label: Pneumonia
text: It started last night with an urgent need to use the toilet, and I've had about 6 episodes of watery diarrhea since then. My abdomen is cramping, and I feel nauseous. I took my temperature and it's normal. I have no chest pain, no cough, and no phlegm at all.

label: Pneumonia
text: I've had very frequent, watery bowel movements all day, maybe 10 times. The stomach cramps are pretty intense right before I have to go. I feel dehydrated and tired. My chest is clear, I have no cough, and my breathing feels perfectly normal.

label: Pneumonia
text: My stomach has been upset for two days now, with at least five episodes of loose, watery stools each day. I'm also dealing with uncomfortable bloating and cramps. I might have a very low-grade fever, but no higher than 99.5Â°F. I have no shortness of breath or any kind of cough.

label: Pneumonia
text: The problem is entirely in my gut. I've had explosive, watery diarrhea about 7 times since this morning. The cramping is significant. I feel a bit lightheaded, probably from losing so much fluid. I want to be clear that I have no respiratory symptoms, no cough, and no chest pain.

label: Pneumonia
text: My body feels like it's on fire with a 103.2Â°F fever for two days. The pain in my bones and muscles is severe, and I have a splitting headache behind my eyes. I feel queasy constantly. I do not have a productive cough, just a dry one, and there's no sharp pain when I breathe.

label: Pneumonia
text: This started about three days ago. I have a high fever, and every joint feels like it's grinding. The headache is intense, especially when I move my eyes. I've had no appetite at all. Breathing is not an issue, and I'm not coughing up any colored phlegm.

label: Pneumonia
text: I've been laid up for four days with a fever that comes and goes, severe muscle aches, and pain behind my eyes. This morning I noticed a faint rash of tiny red dots on my skin. I have no chest congestion and my cough, when it happens, is completely dry.

label: Pneumonia
text: The fever has been relentless for 72 hours, around 102-103Â°F. My body aches all over, making it hard to find a comfortable position. My head is pounding. I vomited once yesterday. I have no trouble breathing and I'm not coughing up anything from my chest.

label: Pneumonia
text: A sudden fever of 103Â°F began two days ago, along with the most intense joint pain imaginable. It hurts to move my eyes. I feel sick and have no desire to eat. Importantly, I have no sharp chest pain when breathing and no phlegm production.

label: Pneumonia
text: It came on so suddenly yesterday. I felt fine at lunch, but by dinner I had a 102.5Â°F fever, chills, and my entire body ached. I'm completely exhausted. I have a dry, hacking cough but I'm not bringing up any mucus. My breathing feels fine, not strained at all.

label: Pneumonia
text: I have a high fever and feel incredibly weak; it started about a day ago. The muscle pain is the worst symptom, it feels like I have the flu. I have a dry cough and a sore throat. There's no difficulty breathing and no colored sputum.

label: Pneumonia
text: The fatigue is profound. I can barely get out of bed. It all started yesterday with a sudden fever of 103Â°F and terrible body aches. I have a cough, but it's completely dry. I have no sharp, localized chest pain that gets worse when I cough.

label: Pneumonia
text: My temperature is 101.9Â°F. The main issues are the overwhelming tiredness and the aches in all my muscles. It began very abruptly. A dry cough started this morning, but I'm not coughing up any phlegm. My chest doesn't hurt when I breathe in.

label: Pneumonia
text: I felt chills and then my temperature shot up to 102.6Â°F in just a few hours. My muscles are so sore it hurts to move. I'm exhausted and have a headache. The cough I have is non-productive, meaning no mucus is coming up.

label: Pneumonia
text: This started with a fever, a constant runny nose, and very red, weepy eyes for three days. My cough is dry and raspy. Just today, a red rash popped up on my face, around my ears and neck. I'm not having any trouble breathing or coughing up colored stuff.

label: Pneumonia
text: First, for about four days, I had a dry cough, stuffy nose, and my eyes were pink and bothered by light. Then, yesterday, a flat, red rash began on my forehead and has since spread downwards. I have no chest pain and the cough produces no phlegm.

label: Pneumonia
text: I have a fever and a rash that started on my face and is now on my trunk. Before the rash, I had a really bad runny nose, red eyes, and a dry, hacking cough for a few days. My breathing is fine, and I have not seen any yellow or green mucus.

label: Pneumonia
text: The illness began with a dry cough, red eyes, and a runny nose. That lasted for three days. Now I have a fever and a red rash that started behind my ears and is moving down my body. There is no shortness of breath.

label: Pneumonia
text: My eyes have been red and watery, my nose has been running constantly, and I've had a dry cough for days. A fever started yesterday, and today this rash appeared on my face. The cough is just dry, with no phlegm or anything coming up.

label: Pneumonia
text: I've felt unwell for over a week, with a fever that just won't break and seems to inch higher every evening. I have a constant headache and feel so weak I can't do anything. I have no appetite. There is no cough and no pain in my chest.

label: Pneumonia
text: This has been a long illness, maybe nine days now. The fever is sustained, my head hurts, and my stomach feels tender. I'm so exhausted all the time. I have not had any breathing problems, and there's no productive cough with colored phlegm.

label: Pneumonia
text: For the past week, I've had a steady fever, a dull headache, and I've lost my appetite completely. The fatigue is the worst part. I may have a slight dry cough, but it's very minor and there's definitely no mucus or chest pain when I breathe.

label: Pneumonia
text: A fever started about 10 days ago and it's been persistent. I feel incredibly drained, have a headache, and some general abdominal discomfort. I haven't been coughing at all, and my breathing is perfectly normal, not fast or labored.

label: Pneumonia
text: I've been sick for what feels like forever, at least a week. It's a continuous fever, a headache that sits in the front of my head, and I feel so weak. I have no interest in food. There are no chest symptoms; my breathing is fine and I have no cough.

label: Pneumonia
text: My only problem is my stomach. For two days, I've had frequent, watery diarrhea, maybe 6 or 7 times a day. I have cramps that come and go. I feel tired from it all, but I have no fever. I am not coughing and I have no difficulty breathing.

label: Pneumonia
text: Since yesterday, I have been having loose, watery stools every few hours. My stomach is cramping badly, and I feel quite nauseated. I have no fever and, to be clear, no respiratory symptoms like a cough or shortness of breath.

label: Pneumonia
text: The main issue is watery diarrhea, which I've had at least 8 times today. The abdominal cramps are severe. I feel weak and a bit dizzy, likely from dehydration. I have no cough, no fever, and no chest pain when I breathe.

label: Pneumonia
text: This started suddenly this morning. I've had 5 bouts of watery diarrhea with urgency and stomach cramping. I feel drained. I have no fever, and I am not coughing up any phlegm or experiencing any chest discomfort.

label: Pneumonia
text: I have had persistent watery stools for about 36 hours now, probably more than 10 times in total. The cramps in my stomach are very uncomfortable. I feel a bit feverish, but my temperature is only 99.8Â°F. My breathing is completely fine, with no cough.
